channel.title: GameStop Trade-In Pricing
channel.description:
[i]Before you start, I'm not concerned about GameStop being a scam as that's well-aware to me. If I did care, I'd look towards eBay.[/i]
Well, I've been looking to buy DBZ: Budokai 2 strictly for the Game Cube (I don't want to be forced to buy it for the PS2 or something else) and I don't want to spend money out of my pocket. The game is $10, and I have a lot of games I could cash in, but I don't want to over-do it as it's all in-store credit.
I was unable to find average pricing for returning used products (Meaning you give them something you've previously owned, bought there or not, and they'll pay you for it and sell it over 9000% than what they gave you), but I have had some experience a while back. I gave them a mint-condition month-old GC game that was $50 and I got $15 in return. But hey, business is business and it's better than having it sit around the house collecting dust.
[b]But anyway, do you think two DS games in brand-new condition (Case, booklets, hardly touched) would get me $10?[/b] The games are Pokemon Diamond and DQM: Joker. There is also a 30% price boost on DS games, so that helps me as well.
~Lin

item.title: GameStop Trade-In Pricing
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:7, topic:341324”][/quote]I don’t see how it’s that hard to acquire 10 dollars, but then again I remember you’re still not of age for a job. If you go over in credit, it couldn’t be that much over anyways.
[/quote]

he didnt say he didnt have 10$. He said he didnt want to pay for it out of his pocket.

Read full topic

Frell:

playntrade++

Tru dat!

item.title: GameStop Trade-In Pricing
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:6, topic:341324”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=437722.msg3216740#msg3216740 date=1274740741]
ffs Lin, you’re so weird. Just get 10 bucks from yo mom or something.
[/quote]I don’t like asking for anything.[/quote]I don’t see how it’s that hard to acquire 10 dollars, but then again I remember you’re still not of age for a job. If you go over in credit, it couldn’t be that much over anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: GameStop Trade-In Pricing
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:4, topic:341324”]well if u really didnt want the game whats the big deal?

if u kinda liked it theres a few words that go well together…

“no thank you, i want more money asshole”[/quote]I would like to keep my games if possible just to add them to my collection. It’s pointless going there with a lot if I’m only going to need to sell a few.

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:3, topic:341324”]ffs Lin, you’re so weird. Just get 10 bucks from yo mom or something.[/quote]I don’t like asking for anything.

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:341324”]Call em up[/quote]Sure, why not. I’ve never had good luck with phone calls and businesses though.

Read full topic

item.title: GameStop Trade-In Pricing
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Don’t ever return games to GS. Because like you said, they pretty much sell for 9000% of what you gained.
Games should be a collection, even if they do “collect dust”.

It just shows what games you liked during the time they came out.

Read full topic

item.description:

well if u really didnt want the game whats the big deal?

if u kinda liked it theres a few words that go well together…
